column4: hey - can anyone help me change my WM? I'm in the gnome default and I'd like to move to Ion3.
: if you don't know how to use Ion, then Ion is not for you.
I've used it for six months on my gentoo box.
I've also tried editing and modifying my ~/.xinitrc
: then what problem do you have? Just create a startup entry for it
the problem is I do not know ubuntu. and the gdm config program doesn't run.
so how do I configure gdm by hand?
: you have to look under /usr/whatever/folder where the desktop entries are stored for gdm to list
: just model a new entry after the exisiting ones, and make it launch your xterms and what not, and finally the Ion wm
: the Exec= entry is your ".xinitrc" script, which can be anything.
seems an ion3.desktopo entry is already there.
: then the entry is in some way incorrect, if it's not listed on the gdm session chooser menu
: in any case, you can always use a different tty and run startx manually. And sudo /etc/init.d/gdm stop to get rid of it (I do, for dwm)
